title: 107_hr2310
content: The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for uniformed services members effective January 1, 2002, based on pay grade and years of service. The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for commissioned officers based on pay grade and years of service. The table shows the percentage increase in monthly basic pay for commissioned officers based on pay grade and years of service. The table displays the percentage increase in monthly basic pay for commissioned officers according to pay grade and years of service. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service as an enlisted member or warrant officer receive percentage increases in monthly basic pay according to pay grade and years of service. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service receive percentage increases in monthly basic pay based on pay grade and years of service, ranging from 8.3% to 7.3% for different pay grades. Warrant officers receive percentage increases in monthly basic pay based on pay grade and years of service, ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% for different pay grades and years of service. Warrant officers receive percentage increases in monthly basic pay based on pay grade and years of service, ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% for different pay grades and years of service. The pay increases are structured in increments of 0.5% for each additional year of service, with the highest increase being 8.5% for over 26 years of service. Enlisted members receive percentage increases in monthly basic pay based on pay grade and years of service, ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% for different pay grades and years of service. The pay increases are structured in increments of 0.5% for each additional year of service, with the highest increase being 10.5% for over 16 years of service. Enlisted members receive percentage increases in monthly basic pay based on pay grade and years of service, ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% for different pay grades and years of service. The pay increases are structured in increments of 0.5% for each additional year of service, with the highest increase being 10.5% for over 16 years of service. Enlisted members receive percentage increases in monthly basic pay based on pay grade and years of service, ranging from 7.3% to 10.5% for different pay grades and years of service. The pay increases are structured in increments of 0.5% for each additional year of service. The adjustment to increase monthly basic pay for uniformed services members in fiscal year 2002, as required by section 1009 of title 37, United States Code, will not be implemented.
